headline: Pork Steaks
description: This pork steak recipe is easy to make in one skillet on the stovetop. Tender, flavorful pork butt steaks are cooked in soy sauce and green onion.

video.description: Learn how to make juicy, tender pork steaks with soy sauce and scallions.
video.name: Pork Steaks

name: Pork Steaks

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat; stir in soy sauce. Add green onions and garlic and cook until lightly browned, about 2 minutes.

Place pork steaks in the skillet. Cover and cook until browned, 8 to 10 minutes per side. Remove the lid and continue cooking until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the steak reads 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), about 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: THIS IS GREAT! I made exactly as instructed, resisting the urge to follow other reviews and alter even the slightest… and I’m so glad I did. I was a little worried about the amount of soy sauce, thinking it would be too salty. I was proven wrong! So tender, so delicious - even my picky eater ate it! Thanks so much! For the photo: I covered one in the sautéed onions and the other I tried to clean off (again, picky eaters!)

I really loved this recipe. I made it last night for my family. I did the butter and soy sauce, added in onions, bell peppers, green onions, red bell peppers and garlic. After I placed in the pork steaks as big as they were, I cooked them 10 minutes on each side , then I place them in the oven on 350 for a few minutes. Boy did they come out tender and delicious. I served them with spinach, macaroni and cheese with dinner rolls. This recipe will be made again. I love it.

I really enjoyed this!! Thank you. I didn't have soy sauce and I looked at a few other people's things they did to change it. I melted butter put in 1 clove of minced garlic and added the pork steaks, I put a little worchestershire sauce on the steaks then added some yellow, green and red peppers on the sides as well as the green onion and inused yellow onion as well. When I flipped them I added some Worcestershire sauce on that side too. Then I added some salt and pepper and some Mrs dash garlic and herb seasoning around the sides on the veggies. When it came time to take off the lid and cook another 10 min. I flipped the steaks again. (In a separate pan I made my fresh green beans with onions and then added the rest of the peppers I had cut up (just in case they didn't taste good on the pork steak side) I do not eat much pork and I definitely don't like cooking it because I get scared I will under cook it. My parents gave me two huge porksteaks they got from my grandpa's butcher so I had to try it out. This is gonna be a great meal to keep my blood sugar low! I loved your directions, Thebtimes plus the temperature directions. I found a thermometer that worked ...pulled it off at lime 150 degrees f....and I can't believe it came out so delicious. I wish I had soy sauce but I loved it how I made it anyway, so, its versatile. thank you so much for your recipe!!! My husband doesn't really like pork and he ate all of his too!!
Baked it instead. Reg potatoes family loved. Didn't make enough. So afraid it wouldn't turn out but it tasted very very yummy.
Super easy! Great flavor! Didn’t have green onions, subbed red. Should have took a pic. Yum!
I thought this was not going to be great but I made it as directed and it was surprisingly delicious. It was quick and easy, definitely a keeper.
Out of little green onions, used regular onions. Tasted very good We'll give this a five
I floured my steaks and cooked with a sliced onion. Excellent! Will make again. Thanks for the recipe.

This tasted great. It's a great addition to my regular rotation in that it has a different flavor than any of my typical dishes. I followed the exact recipe except I dredged the steaks in flour as suggested by the other reviewers. I think I used a too high temperature since the green onions looked a bit dark, and the steaks were done in less time than suggested. I had two large steaks and did not alter the other ingredients. I will cut back on the butter next time. I think one ounce would be enough. And, I'll cook at a less than medium temperature.
Made it exactly like the recipe said loved it!!!
OMG this was a hit. Super easy and very flavorful way to prepare pork steaks in a hurry. Paired well with mash and green beans. Needless to say the family will have me cooking this again
I made it little bit different. I made it with pork cube steak and I served it with a side of pasta.

I should have read the negative reviews and used my own knowledge of cooking. I used a sweet onion as did others who liked this so that shouldn’t matter much. There is no seasoning, therefore it had no flavor and was a miss for us.
Very tasty, no changes!
it was great,added some honey.turn out awesome.
wahoo great recipe.. added chilli flakes and splash of vino however.... beautiful caremalised onions and perfectly cooked tender pork steaks
I'm adding mushrooms at the last few minutes. This is a great recipe.!!!! Love it.
Good flavours, will do again.

Delicious! I cooked this for dinner and my family loved it! Very flavorful. I added a little worcestershire sauce and it made the flavor pop. It's awesome when a recipe this simple tastes so yummy! I will be making this again for sure.
Woah this amazing they said its very nice. i used yellow onion since i dont have green onion and i add some sugar & teriyaki turns good the meat is so tender inlove it gonna cook again!!

Wow! This is my new favorite dish. The pork steaks were very tender (as others have suggested, I dredged the steaks in flour. Tender, tasty pork steak with a yummy gravy. Thanks for posting this great, easy & quick recipe! Definitely a keeper
The pork steaks were delicious!! I followed the recipe except I used half butter and half avocado oil. I made the butter potatoes as our side dish.

We loved this recipe. I used boneless loin chops and dusted them with flour first as suggested by other reviewers. They took a little less time to cook and were delicious - even better as leftovers the next day! I will definitely make them again.
This is perfect
I followed the tips on another comment. A dab of worchestershire sauce and white onions. INCREDIBLE!! I look this recipe up as pork chops onion only way mom.... can't get enough!

I won some pork steaks in a meat raffle and had no idea how to cook them. I started with this recipe, but dredged them in seasoned flour, used half a sweet yellow onion, and added a tablespoon of brown sugar. The sauce was really good and a hit with my family.
The only change I made was to follow another reviewer's suggestion to dredge the meat in flour prior to cooking. The pork was excellent and I will use this recipe again.
I like this new way of making my pork steaks. They weee nice and juicy. I added a lil flour for gravy and some water.

make this at least twice a month...
use green onions or chives and bit more garlic only bc we are a gsrlic overload family...
love this recipe
Very delicious and easy to make! I served the steaks with homemade coleslaw and avocado...yumm!

I pounded my rather large, bone-in, pork steaks to tenderize. Put 1/2 c Amino Acids (in place of soy sauce), 1/4 c. Worcestershire sauce, 1/4 c. red wine in ziplock bag & added the steaks & but in fridge overnight. Next evening, I sliced a med. large onion thinly & lightly browned in 1/2 cube butter. Then I removed the onions, put the other 1/2 cube of butter in skillet, added the floured steaks to the butter to begin browning, adding the onions on top of steaks, then pouring the liquid the steaks had marinated in overnight, adding a bit more amino acids, a little water rinsing out the smallest amount of sweet chili sauce left in a bottle. Covered & cooked over med. heat for about 10 min. Uncovered, turned steaks over & covered, cooked additional 10 min. Took temp. & well done steaks were served with baked potatoes, skillet juices over the potatoes, applesauce, corn. Very delicious!

I was surprised to see this as I make it frequently. I found the recipe in an old cookbook I bought at a garage sale in the early 1980’s! I’d make it tonight except I’m out of Ruth Schuster sauce(my sis in laws name so we always call it that).I was looking for something else to do with pork steak and was delighted to see this. Glad it’s another family favorite.
Overall taste was good, and very tender. However, it was extremely salty! Wouldn’t make again because of that.
Was a delicious recipe. My kids loved it

I was skeptical because it seemed too easy, but decided to try it anyway, having never made pork steaks before. It was delicious and even my two young kids and hard to please husband gobbled it up without complaint. I only had two steaks instead of the 6 recommended, but kept the other ingredients the same. This gave us a good amount for gravy/sauce. Since I didn’t have green onions I substituted half a sweet onion, diced, and I did add a splash of Worcestershire sauce. Served with mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli. This recipe is definitely a keeper.
I would use less soy. Even, 1/4 cup of less sodium was salty.
Tasted great. Like some of the other reviews, I coated the meat with flour before cooking.
So easy! I dredged the pork in flour and that really helped make the sauce smooth and yummy. Next time, I'll add a little cayenne and probably sliced mushrooms. But it's just fine, as is.
Thank you! Thank you so much for this recipe! I had no idea how to fix these! This recipe is excellent! I added green peppers! So good!

I really liked it!

Used regular onion, low sodium soy sauce, a splash of worchester sauce, and also added about a tablespoon of white wine vinegar. Mine was a little bit dry because I don't have a meat thermometer. I put it on medium-low and just found out 65C is more of just a low or simmer, so will do that next time
This recipe was fool proof! I followed it to a T! It was great! Loved it! As suggested by some persons, I added teriyaki sauce and it really came out great! Very moist and juicy!
Delicious!
Didn’t have green onions due to finding this recipe with a last minute recipe search. LOVE it! Perfectly cooked and tasty pork. Had butterflied pork loin chops. Will make again!
Just added olive oil for moisture retention and to keep the meat more tender but other than that it was a great recipe.
This recipe was great. Will save and make again. Hubby thought it was good too. Only change I made was to add extra garlic and did add some Worcestershire sauce as someone recommended.
I loved this recipe!!

My boys loved it. Like others, I didn't have any green onion, so I used sweet onion instead. I also added more soy sauce and it turned out perfectly. The only thing I think I didn't know was what temperature to cook the pork steaks on.
Very easy to make and very delicious.
Very good - dredged then in flour prior to cooking
Great recipe! As suggested, I sprinkled with flour and added some water to have more sauce, it was fabulous, will make again!

I was looking for a new way to cook pork steaks besides grilling or baking. This recipe did not disappoint! The flavor combination of the soy sauce and butter is amazing. I did not have green onions so I used a yellow onion with the garlic. My husband loved them!
It was a perfect quick meal. Sooo tasty and tender. I had pork shoulder steaks, bone in. And I added with the 1/4cup of soy some Worcestershire sauce. So great. I will be making it again.
Such an easy recipe, my wife is from the Philippines and she loved it, said it was just like pork adobo. I loved it also and will definitely cook it again

Simple yet scrumptious! My 6 year old lovesssss them! I did dredge them in seasoned flour as someone else suggested in their review and I used sweet onions. So happy I found this recipe??. Thanks for sharing!
Very good! Loved it!

I had to use shallots rather than the green onions but it turned out ok. I’m a new cook so still figuring out what works and what doesn’t. Serving it with home made mashed potato worked well. I now have a base line on which to move forward.

This was my first time cooking pork chops. I thought the ingredients were easy and cooking the pork went really well. However, my husband did not enjoy the meal. He say the soy sauce through him off. Me, on the other hand, loved it. Lots and lots of flavor.
I loved it! Used regular onions instead of green, because that's what I had. This will go into regular rotation.

Was looking for something new to do with pork chops and came across this recipe. I basically used it as a base having seasoned my chops with seasoned salt and black pepper first, then I prepared the sauce pretty much as it is written only eye balling it and adding more garlic, yellow onions, and fresh ginger. My family of six loved the recipe! No complaints at all and it was a simple dish! Will be adding it to our menu.
I would make it again! Very tasty
Best pork steaks I've ever had! Simple & amazing flavor!
I used tenderized pork and yellow onions with canned mushrooms and was still very good! Husband loved it too!
So simple. First, I cut the meat into cubes and also dredged mine in flour. I used garlic powder and a bit of honey to sweeten it up.
Wonderfully delish!!!

10-3-2019 I made this tonight and I can't see myself eating pork chops any other way. This made them so delicious. I made it with pork butt blade steaks. I dredged them it flour that was seasoned with paprika and seasoned salt. I think that helped it have a gravy like consistency. I also marinated them in buttermilk for an hour then dredged it directly in the flour, no drying off. This is definitely my go to recipe!
Super easy and delicious! Great combination! I did not have green onions so I used about half of a yellow onion and it was really good. I will make this again!
Such a simple recipe with great tasting results! This is definitely a keeper.
So quick & tasty.. Will make again. Next time I'll reduce butter a little & uncover sooner to thicken sauce more.
I loved them. He didn't. His opinion doesn't count for much though so 4 stars
Love pork steaks wanted to try something other than smothering them. Seen this recipe and figured I would give it a shot. Glad I did will make this again. Delicious!

Other than adding a bit of fresh ginger in with the garlic I made no changes to this recipe. To the people saying it has too much soy sauce, I think you should try cooking it a bit longer. The soy sauce will cook off if you give it more time. I will definitely be making this again.
I like. It was easy. Thanks
First time to make pork steak. We both really liked this recipe! Will definitely make again! Inexpensive tasty and tender!

We loved this recipe!!!! I added a little low sodium broth so the soy sauce wouldn't concentrate as much and added 1 1/2 TBSP of sugar to balance the saltiness of the soy sauce. I also microwaved some quartered fresh brussel sprouts for 4 mins and added to the pork when I turned the pork loin over. OMGoodness this is a keeper!

Love this! made several times! Great every time. Tonight I used one garlic knorrs cube and one knorrs onion cube cube crumbled in measuring cup poured in soy sauce stirred up and poured over steaks! Yum! Thanks!

Great recipe! I've made it a few times now and have followed the directions exactly and they've come out great. This last time I made it though, I realized a little too late that I did not have soy sauce :( so I cooked the pork the same way except with double the butter and I coated the pork in flour with seasoning (as another commenter mentioned). I took out the pork steaks once done and added 1/4 cup of marsala wine (the only thing I had) to the same pan with 1/2 cup of heavy cream. It came out tasting like an onion sauce so it was good alternative.

OH my gosh!!! This was so good. Tender, flavorful and pretty easy to make.

Ya, I would recommend this recipe.

I usually try a recipe as written first before I change anything but this was an exception . I made the following changes: 1) I did not have green onions so used a regular white onion. 2) I used low sodium soy sauce, and 3) I used half butter, half olive oil. I used 1 whole onion for 2 steaks and wished I had double the onions, they tasted wonderful having caramelized in the oil. The recipe is easy, quick, and the pork came out tender and with good flavors , it may be a bit too salty for me if I used regular soy sauce but that's just personal taste. Thanks for sharing the recipe.
Very good
Its simple, effective, delicious. Can't beat it. Tender and juicy; full of flavor too.

Good starting point. Added onion powder, garlic powder, and smoked paprika. Loved the idea of everything in zip lock bags; throw out what doesn't get used of the eggs and flour mixture bag and all. Best part, no extra dishes to wash. Cooked these in a heavy stainless steel pan. Watch closely as heat needs to be adjusted so pork cooks through and doesn't burn.

This recipe is absolutely spot on. The ingredients are so basic and can easily be upgraded with mushrooms or really anything else you're in the mood for. Perfectly delicious as is, and cooking times are on the money. This is really a no-fail recipe for preparing a delicious inexpensive cut of pork.
This recipe is fabulous. I recommend it highly.

I made it according to directions, but took a couple of suggestions from others, and lightly breaded and fried the pork steaks first, then added some hot honey in to cut the bitterness of the soy sauce. It was a huge hit at my house, and I was asked to make it again. I put it in my keeper file.
Oddly delicious. Never thought to mix soy sauce and butter. Who knew?!?
Delicious!
i used white onions instead.
Etible but really just tastes of soy sauce. My husband and I agreed we would finish it today but it would need to be doctored a whole lot to make it again.

Made as directed. There was only one issue. There's NO way I could fit 6 steaks in a skillet, to brown them at once. :) 
The chops were delicious. I will use low sodium soy sauce, next time.

These turned out great! I added some coarse black pepper at the start, then some sliced baby portabellas at the end. I used an iron skillet to cook 3 at a time. I kept the lid off a bit more than the recipe called for. Just needed to evaporate some liquids and get a nice sear on the meat. Served with garlic mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts. Great flavor!

I tweak this recipe and add sauteed vidalia onions and mushrooms half way through the cooking of the pork, and add the green onions fresh and at the end. it's cheap, easy, and definitely a family favorite.

I like salt, but buy reducing soy sauce in a pan like this, it becomes super super salty. I knew this because I've done it before, but I tried this recipe anyway. I think this would work much better if the soy was diluted, at least by a third, with water and also to add a bit of sweetness to it, like a couple table spoons full of agave. Had too much of a none note flavor (soy) to where I didn't even taste the onions. The steak was pretty tender though - I was surprised.

I bought some pork shoulder blade steak on sale the other day and was looking for a recipe when I came across this. After reading all the reviews, I decided to try it out with a few adjustments: I doubled the butter and soy sauce, substituted a small purple onion for the green onion because that’s what I had at the house, plus I added 1/4 cup Worcestershire sauce, 1 tablespoon of red wine vinegar, and about a tablespoon of sugar. After sautéing the onion and garlic in the butter, I added the remaining ingredients (minus the pork) and let simmer for about two minutes. Then I poured the sauce over the pork in a baking dish and baked for 45 minuets at 350. When the pork was done I poured the remaining liquid back into the sauce pan and let it reduce before adding some cornstarch and making it a gravy that I topped each pork shoulder blade steak with before serving. I paired it with rice (which everyone chose to top with gravy) and sweet corn. It was a big hit at my dinner table and I will definitely be making it again.

this is an awesome recipe. I used teriyaki sauce in place of soy. i added it at the beginning of the first steak and it got sticky and over cooked. on the second one i added it when i flipped it and it came out perfect. The steaks were super tender and cooked twice as fast as oven baking.
Husband isn't big on pork, but he loved this. Well make again.

I made this and the meat had a wonderful flavor! My green onions did get done too fast. How have you guys prevented this? Did you take them out and put them back at the end or am I cooking it on too high of heat? Thanks for the help!
So next time maybe at a cooking temp. I had it on med high bc I had never done this before so kind of seared one side. Otherwise thanks.

Added an apple, s;iced, at the saute stage, with the other ingredients. 
Beautiful! My wife wants me to make it again soon.

Mike

Cooked this as directed, but ended up calling it quits just a couple of minutes into the "uncovered" stage, as it was in danger of being overcooked. We were wondering how "Asian" it would taste, but it didn't at all - it was just deliciously savory. Restaurant quality, tender and delicious, we ate it with some mashed potatoes, and I used some dissolved cornstarch to thicken the sauce a bit. This is a keeper at our house.
